main event: A bright silver-like object was observed flying at a high altitude in the Four Corners area of Colorado on October 10, 1951.
interesting points: The object was traveling in a NNW to SSE direction at a very high speed., It was observed by several persons for a period of 35 minutes., No sound was heard during the observation., An experienced pilot corroborated the sighting with the same description., The reporting agency is considered a reliable source.
witness description: Reliable civilian observers and an experienced pilot.
